description: Sven Halek makes the decision to release evidence that Marek Halden never existed and was a manufactured persona by the Council, believing all must know the full extent of deception.
Trusted editors and investigators receive irrefutable evidence from Sven: biometric records, communications, and employment data proving 'Marek Halden' was a mask for collective Council action.

Evidence rapidly spreads: network feeds, flyers, and underground channels confirm 'Halden' was fabricated. Outrage explodes. Public trust evaporates, and shock turns to open accusation in every free zone.
Public forums and neighborhood assemblies fracture into suspicion, blame, and argument. Factions turn on one another, accusing each other of complicity. Calls to abolish the Council intensify.

Demands for Council trials rise; some neighborhoods organize citizen tribunals, while others lock down in fear of betrayal. The old dream of collective self-governance splinters, with leaderless drift in some zones.
